page.title: 08TRANSPORT: BUTLER, TITHBY
page.content: A large part of the community of Cropwell Butler works in Nottingham and commutes by car. Access to the City has been improved by the construction of the Clifton Bridge & the conversion of an old rail-line into a vehicular bridge. With the existing Trent Bridge, these three river crossings have attracted commuters to villages south of the river because of the greater ease of access to the City. There is no train service from the villages but there is a regular bus service to Nottingham (about 1 per hour) and a bus to Bingham on Market day. The bus from Bingham to Melton Mowbray (4 times daily on week days) passes Wiverton Hall. There are special buses to the schools at Bingham and Cropwell Bishop in term time.
